member.name: M:GR_NET.EntityType.#ctor(System.String,System.String,GR_NET.EntityType)
member.summary: Creates a new EntityType

member.name: M:GR_NET.EntityType.GetDecendents(System.Collections.Generic.List{GR_NET.EntityType}@,System.String)
member.summary: Recursive function to gather a flat list of all enitities
member.param: The list to which all entity_types will be added and returned
Enter Nothing/Null for leaves only. "All" for everything. Or filter by FieldType (see field type class)

member.name: M:GR_NET.EntityType.IsRoot
member.summary: Checks if this is a root entity
member.remarks: Returns true if this EntityType is a RootEntity type (ie has no parent)

member.name: M:GR_NET.EntityType.GetDotNotation
member.summary: Returns the name of this entity type in Dot Notation

member.name: T:GR_NET.EntityType
member.summary: Local object model to represent GR entity types.
member.remarks: EntityTypes refect the structure of profile properties and collections in the Global Registry. (eg 'person' is an enitity_type. It has a child entity_types of 'first_name', 'last_name' etc) Entity types can be nested (ie they have parents/children). These objects are created by the GR constructor. The main method you are likely to call on this object is GetDotNotation. GR.GetFlatEntityTypeList returs a list of entity types. Calling GetDotNotation on each of these entity types allows you create a list of valid inputs to the Entity.AddPropertyValue method.

member.name: M:GR_NET.People.createPerson(System.String)
member.summary: Crreate a new person and add them to the people_list
member.param: Enter the UserId of this person (ie. the id of this person in your system)
member.remarks: The new person is an entity with one property (client_integration_id). Use the "AddProperty" method on the returned entity to add other attributes (like firstname, lastname, email, etc)

member.name: T:GR_NET.People
member.summary: People is a very tiny class that defnies a group of persons( entites)
member.remarks: GR has a local People member. (gr.people). Create an intstance of gr and use its people member rather than creating your own.

member.name: M:GR_NET.FieldType.isValid(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a FieldType is valid

member.name: T:GR_NET.FieldType
member.summary: Basic class to define the possible values for Field Type in the GR system.
member.remarks: Several of the methods in GR.NET ask for a Type (or field Type) of type string. Rather than enter "integer" is would be better to enter FieldType._integer. This insures that you don't enter an invalid FieldType

member.name: P:GR_NET.My.Resources.Resources.ResourceManager
member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:GR_NET.My.Resources.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:GR_NET.My.Resources.Resources
member.summary: A strongly-typed resource class, for looking up localized strings, etc.

member.name: M:GR_NET.Entity.AddPropertyValue(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Recursive method to add a property (and its ancestor entities)
member.param: The name of the Property in dot notation (eg person.address.city)
The value of this property (eg London)

member.name: M:GR_NET.Entity.ToJson(System.String)
member.summary: Returns this object in JSON format
member.remarks: The JSON response can be supplied to GR API to add/update this entity (and its decendants) to the GR

member.name: T:GR_NET.Entity
member.summary: Local object model to represent GR entity types.
member.remarks: Entities relect actual people and their profile properties. (eg. "Jon Vellacott" is an entity of entity_type 'person'. He has a child Entity (Name=FirstName, value =Jon). )

member.name: M:GR_NET.GR.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: The constructor initialises the GR object.
member.param: The URL of the GR server
member.remarks: The test GR server is used by default.

member.name: M:GR_NET.GR.SyncPeople
member.summary: Update all People stored on this object

member.name: M:GR_NET.GR.GetFlatEntityLeafList(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a flat list of all entity types
member.param: The root entity in dot notation (usually person but could be somethine like person.address)
Leave blank to return leaves only. To return everything enter "All". Otherswise only entities of the specified Type are retured (as listed in the FieldTypes class)
member.returns: A Flat list of all EntityTypes
member.remarks: Note Each entity type has a GetDotNotation function - which allows you to populate a list of enitities in DotNotation(eg person.address.city)

member.name: M:GR_NET.GR.addNewEntityType(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new entity type in GR
member.param: The name of the new entity
The field type (as listed in FieldType class)
member.remarks: The ParentEntity must exist. CAUTION - there is currently no way to delete a created entity.

member.name: T:GR_NET.GR
member.summary: The main object in the GR_NET Libarary
member.remarks: To get started with the GR_NET library create an instance of this class - using the constructor. This class allows you to
